com.broadcom.bt.le.api
Class BleClientProfile

java.lang.Object
  com.broadcom.bt.le.api.BleClientProfile

public abstract class BleClientProfile
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract base class, representing a Bluetooth LE Client Profile.

To implement a new low energy profile, an application must extend this class, initialize it with the desired profile ID and the necessary required or optional services. Included services

Included services are represented by overriding the BleClientService class.

Once this class has been extended for the desired profile, an application may call the connect(BluetoothDevice) or connectBackground(BluetoothDevice) functions to initiate an active or passive connection to the remote device.

Constructor Detail

BleClientProfile

public BleClientProfile(Context context,
                        BleGattID profileUuid)
Creates a BlueClientProfile given this profile's UUID and client application context.

Parameters:
context - Application context used to bind the GATT service.
profileUuid - Unique UUID identifying the profile to be implemented.
Method Detail

cancelBackgroundConnection

public int cancelBackgroundConnection(BluetoothDevice device)
Stops listening for connection attempts initiated by a remote device.

connect

public int connect(BluetoothDevice device)
Initiates a GATT connection to the remote device. If the connection is established successfully, remote services are enumerated automatically.

Returns:
BleConstants.GATT_SUCCESS if the connection is initiated successfully
See Also:
onDeviceConnected(BluetoothDevice), disconnect(BluetoothDevice)

connectBackground

public int connectBackground(BluetoothDevice device)
Prepares a background connection to a remote Bluetooth device.

A background connection allows the remote device to initiate a connection to this profile. After calling connectBackground(BluetoothDevice), the local device will periodically scan for incoming connections from the specified device. An application must call cancelBackgroundConnection(BluetoothDevice) to stop scanning.

See Also:
onDeviceConnected(BluetoothDevice), cancelBackgroundConnection(BluetoothDevice)

deregisterProfile

public void deregisterProfile()
Unregister this profile with the Bluetooth stack.

disconnect

public int disconnect(BluetoothDevice device)
Disconnects an established GATT connection to a remote device.

findConnectedDevice

public BluetoothDevice findConnectedDevice(java.lang.String address)
Looks up a given Bluetooth device address in the list of connected devices. Returns a BluetoothDevice object if the remote device is connected or null if the device could not be found.

init

public void init(java.util.ArrayList<BleClientService> requiredServices,
                 java.util.ArrayList<BleClientService> optionalServices)
Initializes this BleClientProfile object. Takes an array of required services and optional services and saves it in the object for verification when peer connection is made.

Parameters:
requiredServices - ArrayList of BleClientService derived objects indicating the services required for this profile to function correctly.
optionalServices - ArrayList of BleClientService derived objects indicating the optional services that profile might need.

isProfileRegistered

public boolean isProfileRegistered()
Returns whether this profile has been successfully registered with the Bluetooth stack.

See Also:
registerProfile()

onDeviceConnected

public void onDeviceConnected(BluetoothDevice device)
Invoked when a remote device has connected to this profile. This callback may be triggered when a remote device is connected directly using the connect(BluetoothDevice) function or when a remote device initiates a connection to the local device. By default, this function refreshes the services on the remote device.

See Also:
connect(BluetoothDevice), connectBackground(BluetoothDevice), refresh(BluetoothDevice)

onDeviceDisconnected

public void onDeviceDisconnected(BluetoothDevice device)
Called when the profile is disconnected from the peer.

Parameters:
device - Identifies the remote the device that is no longer connected.
See Also:
disconnect(BluetoothDevice)

onInitialized

public void onInitialized(boolean success)
Callback invoked when the profile has been initialized and has successfully connected to the GATT service. The default behaviour of this function is to call registerProfile() next.

See Also:
init(java.util.ArrayList, java.util.ArrayList), registerProfile()

onProfileDeregistered

public void onProfileDeregistered()
Invoked when a profile has been de-registed from the Bluetooth stack.

See Also:
deregisterProfile()

onProfileRegistered

public void onProfileRegistered()
Called when the profile has been registered with the Bluetooth stack. After this callback has been invoked, the application is ready to receive onDeviceConnected(BluetoothDevice), onDeviceDisconnected and related callbacks.

See Also:
registerProfile()

onRefreshed

public void onRefreshed(BluetoothDevice device)
Callback triggered when the profile has refreshed all the services and updated all characteristics.

See Also:
refresh(BluetoothDevice)

refresh

public int refresh(BluetoothDevice device)
Refreshes this client profile. For each service included in the profile, all the characteristics are retrieved and read.

See Also:
BleClientService.refresh(BluetoothDevice)

refreshService

public int refreshService(BluetoothDevice device,
                          BleClientService service)
Refreshes a specific service included in this profile. Gets all the characteristics and values for this service.

registerProfile

public int registerProfile()
Registers this profile with the Bluetooth stack.

Returns:
BleConstants.GATT_SUCCESS if the profile was successfully registered or BleConstants.SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE if the profile has already been registered by another application.

setEncryption

public void setEncryption(BluetoothDevice device,
                          byte action)
Sets the desired encryption level for an active connection. This functino should only be called after a connection to a remote device has been established.

Parameters:
device - Remote device with a currently active connection
action - Encryption level for the active connection

setScanParameters

public void setScanParameters(int scanInterval,
                              int scanWindow)
Defines how aggressive the local devices scans for remote LE devices when a background connection has been requested.
